title: square look. somewhat like the carbon block font
author: roglioro

comments.content:
I suspect it's lettering, but the letter-forms are easy to make and there may well be a font, perhaps in the the techno theme at Dafont  
Not quite wide enough Geom Graphic Bold [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/geom-graphic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830055013/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/geom-graphic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/geom-graphic/")
Could be wrong but to me it's as simple as [Eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830055013/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/eurostile) Extended Black...

Don't know how I missed this, but here is the 100% match:  
Microgramma Bold Extended  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/microgramma/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830055013/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/microgramma/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/microgramma/")  
also available from E+F [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/microgramma/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830055013/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/microgramma/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/microgramma/") and URW [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/microgramma/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830055013/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/microgramma/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/microgramma/")  
Don
